content.description: Looking at the Calvalry Boulder, climb the crack/flake to the right. Highball. Have a pad and a spotter.

I am not very sure how this starts. Option 1: stem out the cave and use the bedrock ledge to set yourself on crimps, then dyno way left to the "jug". Option 2: use a left hand sloper and right hand crimps to somehow make it to the "jug". From the "jug", it looks like a mellower layback crack to the topout.
content.protection: It has a good landing. Use pads.
content.location: This is to the right of the V3 crack on the main overhung face of the main Cavalry Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the small rock with a high flat left hold on the arête and a thin, right, crimpy sidepull out on the face, move up to a wide, right sidepull, deal with the slopey left arête, and top out.
content.location: This ascends the sheer arête about 10-12 feet left of The Smiley Problem.

content.description: Start sitting at the base of the shallow dihedral and lay-back your way up through some interesting hand sequencing. Shift around the arete when you get to the ledge at 12 feet. High feet makes some of the move a little awkward, but it is super techy and fun.
content.location: This ascends the left side of SW arete.

content.description: This line looks like a smiley face, and you will certainly smile after sending it.  Sit start with matched hands on the smiley rail, pull to the "nose", and pop to the "YES" holds at the top.
content.location: This problem is all the way around the backside of the Calvery Block(s), set in a comfortable nook where the bouder meets the bedrock.

content.description: Sit/crouch start and move up to a slopey topout.
content.location: This is at the back of the Cavalry Boulder. Locate the boulder with the horizontal crack on the far left side.

content.description:
To the left of "Calvary V5, V5," there is a tall, less-than-vertical face with very pleasant but very off-the-deck climbing. There are two cruxes. The harder of the two is near the ground.

 Start standing at the arete near the entrance to the "ally," and move your way up and right onto the face.
content.location: As you approach the boulder, you'll see Calvary V5, V5, first. The face between that climb and the arete at the entrance to the "ally" is the line. Some variations exist that are all about V0/V0+.

content.description: Sit start the arête and either drop off at 15 feet or hook into a top rope and punch it to the top.
content.location: Locate the split in the Calvary Boulder that divides the block, and look for this tall, proud arête.

content.description: Looking directly at the massive Calvalry Boulder, this is the crack to the left. Climb the crack.

pathTokens: Cavalry Boulder Field aka Gymnasium aka Playground

content.description: This is the massive boulder toward the top of the hill. The boulder boasts a great selection of problems from relatively moderate to very hard. Mostly highball. Bring your friends, and have them bring their pads.
